11132221112.content:
Ash was training for his gym battle against Bonnie's brother Clemont, getting his trusted Pikachu to increase his speed and stamina. Ash gleefully cheering him on giving him instructions

"That's It Pikachu we'll be ready for Clemont in no time!" Ash gloated

"Pika pika!" Pikachu agreed as he trained. Meanwhile both Serena and Bonnie were watching Ash intently, Serena had a blush on her face seeing him in action while Bonnie looked impressed.

"Not bad but your going to need more than that to beat my brother!" Bonnie shouted, then she noticed Serena was quiet

"Hey what's up?" The young blonde girl asked. This whisked Serena back to reality.

"Huh, oh I was.....impressed by Ash's training." Serena said with a blush on her face.

"His training or him?" Bonnie teased, which cause Serena's blush to go even more red before sighing.

"Guess there's no hiding it from you, I just wish he would notice." The honey hair coloured girl sulked.

"Cheer up I'm sure he'll notice you one day." Bonnie assured. "Anyways wanna drink?" she pulled out this weird pink liquid and showed it to Serena.

"Bonnie, where did you get this?" She asked

"Bought it, the guy said it was supposed to help you find true love or some nonsense like that, as if I'm dumb enough to believe it." Bonnie eye rolled.

"Then why did you buy it?" Serena asked

"To prove him wrong of course, I'm going to drink this to show there's nothing wrong with it, but I need a second person to test it to verify my claim which is why I want you to drink it with me." Bonnie explained.

"Are you sure about this?" The older girl queried.

"Of course, watch." Bonnie boasted before taking a drink of the potion. "Hey this is actually tasty, here."

Serena was a bit skeptical but drank it too nonetheless and to her shock Bonnie was right.

"Wow this is good!" Serena exclaimed happily. Their thoughts were interrupted as a jolt of electricity came down as the familiar cry of "Pika......CHUUUUUUUUUUU!!" Bellowed. Both girls drew their attention to the commotion to find Ash getting his Pikachu to thunderbolt a immobile target he set up

"Nice work Pikachu!" Ash cheered his partner on. The second their eyes laid on the black haired Pokemon trainer, both girls blushed frantically.

Oh wow, I never noticed how handsome Ash was Bonnie thought with glee. Meanwhile Serena was having a different effect.

I'm done being shy Serena knew what she wanted to do, and she marched up to the boy in question to do it. Ash noticed her approaching him and greeted her with a smile.

"Hey Serena want to have a Pokemon..." Ash was cut off with Serena putting a finger on his lips, she gave him a sultry look before kissing him.

"MMM?!" Ash was confused at what was going on, after she was done kissing him she gave him a stern but endearing look.

"Listen here Ash, I'm doing playing the waiting game, I'm done not being able to tell you how I feel so I'm going to spell it out for you. I love you, I loved you ever since we were kids and you helped me find my hat." Serena confessed.

Meanwhile Bonnie was seething in anger How dare that hussy take my man away from me, Ash is mine Bonnie stormed up to them to claim Ash for himself Bonnie angrily coughed

"No, I won't let this happen, why settle for her?!" Bonnie angrily shouted before flashing Ash a seductive smile "When you can have me handsome." She blew him a kiss and gave him a wink. Now Ash was really confused. Serena in turn was angered at her so called friend.

"How dare you keep my Ash away from me traitor!!" She shouted.

"Your Ash?! He's mine, I love him with all my heart and I know I can show him what a real girlfriend is like!" Bonnie argued back.

Ash....
11132221112.title: Serena and Bonnie, looks like Ash is starting t...

111322211121.content:
Couldn't take the fighting anymore and sternly looked it them.

"Stop fighting you two, you're supposed to be friends!" He practically shouted. This had the desired effect as both Bonnie and Serena looked at him warmly

"Sorry my love I didn't mean to upset you." Serena apologized.

"We'll behave just for you." Bonnie agreed before turning to Serena "Sorry about earlier."

"I'm sorry too." Serena mentioned back "We really shouldn't be fighting."

"So what do we do." Bonnie asked mockingly seeing where this was going.

"We share him of course, we both take turns dating him. I'll get him Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, you Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays, and on Sundays we can both enjoy his presence."

"Nice try Serena but today is Monday." Bonnie smirked. Serena pouted a bit.

"Worth a try, alright we flip a coin, heads it's my suggestion, tails I'll swap the days around." Serena offered.

"Deal, but we use my coin!" Bonnie agreed and showed her a coin. Serena having no issues with that grabbed it and flipped it.

"Hey wait don't I get a say in this?!" Ash mentioned

Both of them turned to him and smiled.

"Of course you do sweetie but why would you want to turn us down?" Serena mentioned in a suggestive tone as she grabbed the coin. when it came down.

"Don't you find us beautiful my love?" Bonnie chimed in. Ash was beat red and stammering.

"W..well I never thought of it before but.... yeah I do." Both girls giggled.

"Oh good he does like girls, I was starting to worry." Bonnie joked, Serena laughed while Ash was even more red in the face. Serena took this time to look at the coin.

134.content:
(Since Roxas is the only playable character, we go with him)

Now, where in the game shall we start?
134.title: 358/2 days

1342.content:
It is an ordinary day of heart collecting for Roxas. He has been busy traveling all over Twilight Town, slashing through Shadows, Soldiers, and more Heartless than he could count.

"Phew, I think that's enough for today." He says eventually.

On his way to the tower, he comes across yet another Shadow which attacks him. "Another one?" Roxas says exasperated. He fights back with his Keyblade. Surprisingly, this Shadow is stubborn and doesn't die easy. Eventually, it starts running off. "Come back here!" Roxas yells as he gives chase. The chase leads him to what appears to be an empty house, which it is, since nobody lives there. Inside the house, Roxas prepares himself but it appears that the Shadow got away. "Oh great, he got away." Roxas says as he dismisses his Keyblade.

Suddenly, he sees what appears to be a container of some kind of fluid. "What is this?" Roxas wonders out loud. Normally, someone would just leave it alone. However, Roxas, being the curious type, decides to take it with him to ask someone about it.

What is it?
1342.title: Middle

13421.content:
Carrying the strange substance with him, Roxas gets some ice cream and heads to the Station Tower. He is the first one there, so he just waits there for Axel and/or Xion to arrive.

Eventually...
13421.title: Love Potion

choices: she falls madly in love with Roxas
she already loves Roxas and can't hide it anymore.
134212.content:
Eventually, Xion comes around the corner.

"Hello Roxas." She says with a smile.

"Hi Xion" He replies as she sits down next to him. The two of them talk about their day while finishing their ice cream. Eventually, Roxas gets to what he wants to ask. "Hey Xion, do you have any idea what this is?" He asks holding up a bottle of the strange fluid. It is an odd pink color.

"Hmm, I don't know. I've never seen it before. Have you tasted it?" She asks.

"No, I haven't" Roxas replies.

"How about I try it out? Maybe we'll find out something." Xion suggests.

"I don't know. It might be dangerous." Roxas says.

"Come on, what's the worst that could happen?" Xion says with confidence. Unfortunately, that is a clear indicator that something bad is going to happen. However, Roxas and Xion, due to their limited time existing, without memories of their pasts don't have that knowledge yet so Roxas hands over the bottle of the fluid to Xion. She opens the top of the bottle and slowly takes a few sips of it.

"How is it?" Roxas asks.

"Tastes like strawberries." Xion responds, and then she continues to drink it down.

"Wow, you're really thirsty huh?" Roxas asks. As Xion continues to drink the mysterious drink, strange feelings start to swell within her. Eventually, she finishes the whole thing.

"That tasted good!" Xion says with excitement.

"Apparently." Roxas says staring at the empty bottle as Xion turns and looks at him to continue talking, however something happens upon her looking at him.

What is up with Xion now?
134212.title: Xion arrives

1342121.content:
As soon as Xion's eyes make contact with Roxas, she can't help but stare at him. Suddenly she sees him in a different light. His clear blue eyes, blonde hair, that cute confused expression on his face. A huge blush appears on her cheeks.

'Wow, I never realized Roxas was so handsome.' She starts thinking. Meanwhile, Roxas is perplexed at why Xion is staring at him, red as a tomato.

"Hey, Xion. Hello?" He says and starts waving his hand in front of her face. Suddenly, Xion actually blinks and stops staring. "You okay? You kind of spaced out for a second there." He says, concerned.

"Oh, I-I'm ok." Xion assures him and turns away from him, still blushing. 'He's so sweet.' She thinks, and then she gives a dreamy sigh.

As Roxas sits confused at Xion's sudden change in behavior...
1342121.title: she falls madly in love with Roxas

13421211.content:
Xion quickly runs one of her hands through her hair, trying to make it look nicer. Once she is satisfied, she starts scooting over to Roxas. Soon enough, she is practically right up against him.

"Uh, are you ok?" Roxas asks, a little nervous at how close Xion is.

"I'm fine Roxas, really. I just enjoy your company." Xion says with a smile as she leans her head on his shoulder. To anyone who would be looking, they would look like a young couple in love.

What happens next?
13421211.title: she scoots closer to him

134212111.content:
"I wonder if Axel will ever show up." Roxas wonders out loud. Suddenly, Xion turns her head towards him and smiles.

"You know, we have all this time to ourselves. Let's have some fun with it." She says. Roxas, of course, is confused as to why she said that, and what she meant. However, before he can think of anything else, Xion starts moving her face closer to his. She slowly closes her eyes and her lips come in contact with his. Xion is kissing him.

Roxas has no idea what to do in this situation. What should he do?
134212111.title: Xion tries to kiss him

1342121111.content:
Roxas really has no idea what Xion is doing. However, deep down, some part of him is enjoying the the feeling of Xion's lips on his own. Slowly but surely, before he even knows what he is doing, his own eyes close and he starts to kiss her back. The two are completely oblivious to their surroundings. All they can think about is this feeling that they share right now. After about 5 minutes or so, their bodies require oxygen, so they pull back, slightly panting.

'What was that?' Is all Roxas can think about, not understanding the concepts of love and kissing yet. Meanwhile, Xion is ecstatic that Roxas kissed her back.

'Maybe he likes me back!' She thinks, giving a slightly girly squel at the thought of it. Xion then cuddles up next to Roxas again, rests her head again, and closes her eyes. "I love you Roxas." She says.

'Love? What's that?' Roxas wonders, because, as stated earlier, he doesn't understand the concept of love, but being the nice guy he is, he lets Xion cuddle next to him as they watch the sunset.
1342121111.title: kiss back

13421211111.content:
The very next day, Roxas wakes up and proceeds to the Gray Area. All he can think about is what happened the previous day. After he and Xion spent some time on the tower, he suggested that they should RTC. Xion looked disappointed that they couldn't stay longer, but she smiled and obeyed him. She grabbed his hand and they RTC'd hand-in-hand. As they arrivied, they got some odd looks from the other members, although they did get a wolf whistle from Demyx and he said "Way to go Roxas!" Of course, Roxas didn't know what he was talking about. After that, Xion wanted to sleep in his room with him, but he insisted otherwise. She looked a little sad, but she quickly lightened up and gave him one of her dazzling smiles.

"Well, good night, my love." She said as she kissed him on the cheek and went to her room.

Anyway, back to the current day, Roxas wants to know what is up with Xion. Eventually, he comes across...
13421211111.title: the next day

134212111111.content:
Roxas eventually comes across Axel. "Hey Axel" He says.

"Oh, hi Roxas." Axel replies. Axel had saw Roxas and Xion holding hands as they returned but he didn't think anything of it.

"Uh Axel, can I ask you something?" Roxas asks.

"You just did" Axel replies, his sense of humor returning. Roxas looks a little down after that. "Sheesh I was just kidding. What is it then?" Axel asks.

"Um, what is love?" Roxas asks. He has yet to have the love talk from Xaldin and Axel at this point.

"Wooh, what brought this all of a sudden?" Axel asks, a bit surprised.

"Well, yesterday, Xion said that she loved me. I was confused at first because I didn't know what she meant. She also pressed her lips against mine, and, for some reason, something made me keep it like that. I couldn't push away." He replies. To say Axel is shocked would be a major understatement.

"Oh boy." Axel sighs, hardly feeling like the right person to explain this.

"Please Axel!" Roxas says, practically pleading his best friend.

"Well, how do I put this? Love is an emotion. It's when two people feel something special towards each other. It's different from being best friends." Axel explains.

"So, it's a step above best friends?" Roxas asks.

"Well, yes and no. I wouldn't exactly call them steps." Axel says, a little nervously.

"I'm confused." Roxas says.

"Well, usually, you need a heart to feel love." Axel says. That makes Roxas think for a while.
134212111111.title: Axel

choices: Roxas and Xion go on separate missions
They go on a joint mission
1342121111111.content:
After Axel's "pep talk," Xion enters the Grey Area. She looks around frantically for a bit looking for Roxas. When her eyes land on him, her face lites up like a thousand lights. "Hello Roxas, how are you today?" She asks cheerfully. Axel is a little shocked at Xion's rather excited entrance.

Roxas, like he does with all his friends, smiles and replies, "I'm good. How are you Xion?"

"I'm good thanks. Even better now that you're here, my love." She replies as she kisses him on the cheek.

'Maybe I need to find a somebody who can really explain love.' He thinks, looking at Axel with a face that says "see what I mean?" Not that he doesn't trust Axel, but, like Roxas, Axel is a nobody, so maybe Roxas should get a somebody to help him.

They haven't gotten their missions yet so Axel goes off to another part of the room to think. Roxas sits down on the couch and Xion sits right next to him, hardly giving him any space. "Umm, Xion? Can you please give me some space?" Roxas asks. Suddenly, Xion looks a little frightened and sad. "Oh, I'm sorry! Am I annoying you?" She asks, as a little water gathering in her blue eyes.

"It's ok. I'm not mad Xion. I just need a little space." Roxas says politely.

With that, Xion perks up and smiles. "Ok, whatever you say, my love." She says as she scoots over a little bit to give Roxas a little room.

"Thanks." Roxas says.

Then, Saïx comes into the Grey Area to give the members their missions.
1342121111111.title: continue

13421211111111.content:
"Roxas, you go and exterminate the Heartless in Twilight Town. Xion, you go do the same in Beast's Castle." Saïx says as he gives his orders. For Roxas, it is convenient for him so maybe he can talk to Pence and his friends to see if they can explain what love is. On the other hand, Xion looks a little crestfallen at not being paired with Roxas for this misson. Seeing this, Roxas walks over to her.

"So, I'll see you at our usual spot right?" He says with a smile. Seeing him smile cheers Xion up and she nods her head vigorously.

"I'll see you there." She says with a smile and quickly gives Roxas a small peck on the right cheek before opening a dark corridor and passing through. Demyx once again applouds Roxas, although Roxas has no idea what Demyx means by his next words, "smooth operator." Saïx looks disgusted (then again, he always does). Xigbar chuckles at the scene while Xaldin and Luxord looks indifferent.

"Well well, Kiddo and the Poppet. Will wonders never cease?" Xigbar says, still chuckling.

"Don't call me that!" Roxas says at being called "Kiddo." Xigbar just chuckles again. Roxas walks through the dark corridor to complete his mission.

Axel just says "Well, things are going to be interesting from here on.". He then proceeds to Agrabah for his mission.
13421211111111.title: Roxas and Xion go on separate missions

134212111111111.content:
Roxas exits his corridor and looked out at Twilight Town.

"Hopefully, I can find Pence and his friends to help me after I complete my mission." He says to himself as he prepares his Kingdom Key. As usual, Twilight Town is full of Shadows and Soldiers and such. Bottom line, not the most dangerous Heartless. Eventually, Roxas reaches the square which seems to be a large meeting area. As he does, something surprises him. "Woah, what is that?!" He yells as metallic pieces come together to form a head, torso, two hands, and two legs. It is a Living Armor. "All right, let's finish this" Roxas says as he charges into the battle.

The Living Armor fights using it's sharp hands to claw at Roxas, but he is able to dodge many of the blows. Then, the arms and legs separate from the body and Roxas knows that is his chance. "Nice try! Event Horizon!" Roxas cries as he activates his Limit Break, since he'd taken just enough damage to use it. His keyblade becomes bathed in light as he repeatedly slashes through the Living Armor's arms and legs. Once they are gone, all that is left is the body and head. However, once the arms and legs are gone, the rest is an open target. "You're finished!" Roxas cries out as he goes into Final Limit. 4 pillars of light surround him and spread out, cutting through the last of the Living Armor. As it falls, a big heart floats out of it's corpse and into the sky.

"That's done." Roxas says, putting away his keyblade. As he is about to walk off to look for Pence and his friends, he hears something nearby.

"Is it gone?" He hears.

"Yeah, it's gone." Roxas affirms. From behind a gate walked Hayner, Pence and Olette. Of course, at this time, Roxas had only met Pence.

"Hey Roxas, how are you doing?" Pence asks.

"Good. How about you?" Roxas replies.

"Oh same old same old." Pence says.

Uh, who is he?" Hayner asks.

"This is Roxas. I met him a while ago when he and one of his friends were searching for another of their friends. Oh, did you find your friend after all?" Pence asks.

"Yeah, thanks to you." Roxas says.

"Ah, shucks." Pence says, slightly embaressed.

"Well anyway, thanks for taking out that thing." Hayner says as he walks off.

"Hey, wait for me Hayner! See you later Roxas!" Pence says as he chases after Hayner. Olette is still there. "So, who was your friend?" She asks.

"Her name is Xion. We spend almost every day together." Roxas replies.

"Oh, that's so sweet!" Olette says. Then, Roxas remembers.

"Oh, can I ask you something?" He asks

"Sure, what is it?" asks Olette.
134212111111111.title: Follow Roxas

13421211111112.content:
"Roxas, you go and exterminate the Heartless in Twilight Town. Xion, you go do the same in Beast's Castle." Saïx says as he gives his orders. For Roxas, it is convenient for him so maybe he can talk to Pence and his friends to see if they can explain what love is. Xion, however, will not have it, tired of Saïx's treatment of her, and wanting to be with Roxas.

"No!" Xion exclaims. Getting surprised looks from everyone.

"What?" Saïx asks in shock, not used to being talked back to, and by Xion of all people.

"Give me a mission with Roxas!" Xion demands.

"Why should I do that?" Saïx sneers.

-a few minutes later-

Saïx is beaten and bloody, groaning in pain, while Xion is still beating on him, while every other member in the room is looking on with a mixture of shock and fear, shocking most of them again since fear is an emotion, something they shouldn't have.

"I don't know what I'm more confused about..." Axel says, still in shock. Everyone turns to look at him, interested. "... Xion's reaction, or the fact that Saïx is bleeding."

"What do you mean?" Roxas asks.

"You're supposed to need a heart to bleed since it is what pumps blood." Everyone is silent at that, realizing Axel's point.

"We'll have to think about this later..." Xaldin says, regaining his composure and crossing his arms.

"Alright!" Saïx shouts in agony. "I'll give you a mission with Roxas if you stop attacking me!" Xion stops.

"You'd better not try and trick me, or I'll do worse to you, things so bad that you'll beg me to kill you in order to end it." Xion says, glaring at him.

"What could you do that would be worse than-" Saïx begins, before seeing Xion with a grin on her face that says 'try me.' "-Never mind."

Which mission does he give?
13421211111112.title: They go on a joint mission

134212111111121.content:
"Fine, you both will do the Twilight Town mission. Just go!" Saïx said in fear as he limped off to wash the blood off of him. Xion instantly beamed and hugged Roxas out of excitement. This got even more odd looks from the Organization.

"Well, you two better get going." Axel said.

"Sure. Let's go Roxas!" Xion said, still smiling and clinging to Roxas as if he was a teddy bear. He just went along with it. The two of them proceeded through the dark corridor.
134212111111121.title: The one for Twilight Town

1342121111111211.content:
On the other side of the dark corridor, Roxas and Xion emerge. Xion is still clinging to Roxas's arm as if her life depended on it.

"Are you ready Roxy?" She said, using a new pet name for him. Roxas looked a bit bewildered by her new name for him.

"Roxy?" He asked.

"It's cute." Xion explained, still beaming. Now Roxas was beginning to become uncomfortable.

'Is this how all girls are when they're in love?' He thought to himself. 'I'll just have to ask Pence or somebody.'

"Well, anyway." Roxas said, starting to calm down. "We should locate that Giant Heartless." He explained.

"All right, my love." Xion replied. However, as they started to walk, Xion noticed that Roxas had his mind on something else.

"Are you ok Roxas?" Xion asked with concern.

"Well, it's just that I wanted to talk to someone about something as soon as possible." Roxas explained.

"About what?" Xion asked.

"It's personal." Roxas replied. Xion smiled and accepted that answer.

Then, Xion got an idea. "How about I take care of the Heartless while you run your errand?" She suggested. Roxas was surprised.

"Are you sure? It could be dangerous." Roxas said. Xion just shook her head and smiled again.

"I would be happy to help you Roxas. I would do anything for you, my love." She assured him. All Roxas could do was nod. They agreed to for Roxas to join up with her after he was finished. She kissed him on the cheek before running off to get to work.
1342121111111211.title: to Twilight Town

13421211111112111.content:
With Xion taking out the Heartless, that freed Roxas up to find Pence. He took some time searching around the town. Eventually, he found Pence where he first saw him, in the tunnel.

"Hey Roxas, how's it going?" Pence asked, happy to see Roxas again.

"Hi Pence, I'm fine. Can I ask you something?" Roxas asked.

"Sure why not?" Pence replied. Roxas took some time before asking his question.

"Do you know what love is?" He asked. Pence looked surprised at the question.

Huh? Why would you ask that?" Pence asked.

"Well, one of my friends told me that she loves me. However, I just don't understand what it means." Roxas explained. Pene thought for a minute and then nodded in understanding.

"You must have had a rough childhood huh?" Pence replied.

"I don't know, I don't remember anything up until a couple months ago."

"Well, I'm probably not the best person to explain this." Pence said.

What does he do?
13421211111112111.title: Follow Roxas

134212111111121111.content:
"I'm not exactly an expert on this subject, considering I've never had a girlfriend myself." Pence said.

One of them was the Princess of the Divine Dragons, a girl named Tiki. After Bantu and Marth were able to wake her from Gharnef's grasp, she happily joined them, becoming a little infatuated with Marth himself.

And so, we start a little while after the battle at the Fane of Ramon, where the army is resting for a while. "A much needed break" said Marth as he rested himself. He especially needed the break after the fighting. Then, he got a visitor. "Mar-Mar!" yelled a very young voice. Marth smiled and turned around to see Tiki right behind him. For a dragon princess over 1200 years old, she acted like a 10 year old due to lack of memories.

Then again, Marth thought it may be better that way for her. "Hello Tiki, what do you need?" he asks her politely. "Where are we going?" she asks in all her innocence. "We're going to Grust first. Need to take care of them first. I'm sure you'll be ready then?" he asks. "You bet! Nobody can beat us!" said the young princess. Marth laughed at her enthusiasm.

Then, Tiki walks off to have a little alone time. As stated earlier, she was a little infatuated with the young Altean prince. However, she probably didn't really know it since she was so young in a manner of speaking.

However, she comes across something in the nearby forest.
15533212112.title: after Marth reclaims Altea

155332121121.content:
As Tiki walked through the forest, she came across something odd. It was a vial, full of pink liquid. "What's this?" asked the little dragon princess. Innocent as she was, she was oblivious to any possible danger.

She picked up the vial, finding nothing wrong with it. She suddenly felt very thirsty however. "Hmm, well I am quite thirsty" she said to herself. "I guess a little drink wouldn't hurt" she told herself as she took the top off of the bottle. Soon enough, she chugged down the vial of pink liquid, feeling odd as she did.

When she was done, Tiki felt a little wierd. Her cheeks were rosy, as if she was blushing. "Maybe I drank a little too much" she told herself, oblivious to the real change.

"Tiki! Are you out there?" asked a voice. It was Marth, wondering where she was.
155332121121.title: Pink potion

1553321211211.content:
"Over here!" said Tiki, not aware of what would happen. Marth approached her from behind her. "Oh good, you're ok. I was wondering where you were" he said with worry. "Oh, I was fine" said Tiki as she turned around to face him face to face.

Just as she opened her eyes to him, Tiki felt so strange. Suddenly, her heart started racing at levels she had never had before. Her face was probably red as a tomato by now. 'What am I feeling?' she thought in her mind. She had a slight infatuation for the Prince but she was feeling..as if it was much more than that. She suddenly felt rather shy, more so than usual.

"You ok?' asked Marth, seeing how red in the face she was. "I-I'm fine really!" she replied rather quickly. "Ok" said Marth smiling again. Tiki felt the urge to smile as well. 'He cares for me so much' came into her head. Due to being a kid mentally, Tiki had trouble understanding these feelings.

However, she could say that she felt..good. Like being around Marth made her really happy, happier than she had been in her whole life.
1553321211211.title: She looks at him

15533212112111.content:
"Well, let's head back" said Marth, extending his hand like the gentleman he was. Tiki kept on blushing as she accepted his hand and the two walked back to the camp. 'I need to ask someone about what I'm feeling' thought the "young" dragon princess. Before too long however, the two had arrived back at the camp.

However, Tiki needed some advice on what she was feeling. However, she realized that it might be difficult for others to give her an answer, considering that she was a dragon girl.

"Maybe I should just forget about it" she decided. She'll figure it out eventually on her own. With that in mind, she continued following Marth back into the camp.
15533212112111.title: Back in the camp

155332121121111.content:
After their little conversation, and more awkwardness from Tiki, the two of them walked back into the camp. Tiki held onto Marth's hand as if it was her only lifeline. She pretty much had a massive blush on her face the whole time. Some people saw them come back in like that. Some of them found Tiki's "childish" feelings for Marth to be cute.

Soon after however, Marth was called to discuss some strategies for the next battle. This left Tiki by herself again. "So I'm by myself again" she mumbled to herself, disappointed to be separated from Marth.

Anyway, she took a walk around the campsite, contemplating her feelings for the Altean Prince. She couldn't understand what she felt. All she knew was that she wanted a larger place in his heart, and she had difficulty understanding even that part.

However, her thoughts were interrupted when her foot rammed into something. "OW!" yelled the Manakete Princess as she held her hurt foot while jumping on her one good foot. She looked down to see what she hit.

It was yet another vial.
155332121121111.title: Back in camp

1553321211211111.content:
Tiki jumped as she spotted another vial of unknown fluids. This time, it was blue instead of pink like the previous one. However, Tiki wasn't stupid. She had a feeling whatever she drank a while ago effected her somehow. She wasn't going to put herself in more odd situations.

"No way." The young girl said as she walked away, not allowing herself to pick up the potion. She didn't want herself to get in more trouble. However, she probably should have at least put it where no one else could find it.

Because, unfortunately, another person would come up and take the potion. Someone without Tiki's prior knowledge of the potion's powers.

Who would it be though?
1553321211211111.title: Blue Potion

15533212112111111.content:
After Tiki left the mysterious vial untouched in the ground, another individual came up near it. This time, it was Maria, a cleric and one of the princesses of Macedon, along with her sister Minerva. Similar to Tiki, Maria also shared a bit of an infatuation for Marth. Although, while Tiki's affection was more childish (according to everyone else), her infatuation with the young prince stemmed from the more typical handsome prince saves the lovely princess thing. Of course, that started when Marth freed her from her years of captivity in prison.

Anyway, the young, often stubborn, cleric came up to where Tiki just was. Of course, she was still in her little romantic fantasies. The ones Minerva would wish she would grow out of by now. However, just like Tiki, she was shaken out of her thoughts by her foot hitting something hard.

"Ouch! What was that?!" Maria yelled as she grabbed her injured foot. Then, she looked down and saw the blue vial on the ground. "Oh, looks like someone dropped this." She said in her naivette. As she picked it up, she started thinking about how thirsty she was.

"Well, a small drink wouldn't hurt." The red haired princess said as she took off the top of the bottle and poured some into a cup. She brought it to her lips to have a little drink. She was interupted, however, by a familiar precence, one who didn't realize that Maria had just picked up a bottle off of the ground to have a drink, so the person thought that it was a drink that Maria had brought with her.

"Maria! Could I have a drink?" A voice from behind her asked. Maria poured out some more into another cup, which she handed to her companion, neither realizing that the bottle refilled itself. The two down their drinks. Who drank it with Maria?
15533212112111111.title: Maria

155332121121111111.content:
Minerva and her sister enjoyed the drink that Maria had offered her. 'Such a strange drink' thought the older of the Macedonian Princesses. Such was a similar thought in Maria's mind. When she was done, she and Maria looked right at each other.

"Well, Maria, that was..." Minerva started. However, both her and Maria felt very faint when they looked at each other. 'Ugh, my head' thought Maria as she slowly passed out. Minerva passed out as well. Surprisingly, the vial landed on the ground but didn't break or lose any of its contents.

It felt like hours to Minerva when she finally awoke. "Ugh, what was that?" she muttered to herself. Then, she noticed something odd. Her voice was a little higher than usual and her body felt smaller and weaker. Slowly, she sat up and looked at herself. "What?!" she yelled when she did. She didn't have her usual red armor on but rather a while cleric dress like Maria's wear.

"Why am I wearing Maria's clothes?" Minerva asked. However, she got her answer soon. She heard another person slowly getting up and looked at her. However, Minerva soon wished she hadn't, for she saw her own body waking up. "Wait, if that's my body, then who am...?" she started before a realization came to her. She was in Maria's body!
155332121121111111.title: Minerva

155332121121111112.content: If not her, then who is it then?
155332121121111112.title: someone else

1553321222111.title: Before freeing the Western Isles

15533212221111.content:
*****Chapter 12: The True Enemy*****

"There has to be treasure in here" said Cath to herself. The "master thief", as she self-proclaimed herself, was on the Western Isles, taking what treasure she could from the ruling nobles. In her mind, with all the back-breaking work the common folk did on this island, the Etrurian nobles hardle deserved the treasure, which gave Cath more than enough insentive to steal them. Not for herself of course, but to help the common people.

Anyway, after pilfering a couple chests, Cath noticed another in the corner of the room.

"Jackpot!" she smirked to herself, walking over and picking the lock expertly. Inside the chest was something that was not familiar to Cath, and perplexed her a bit. It was a small vial, about the size of an elixir bottle. It was filled with an odd pink liquid, and the smell it gave off reminded Cath of strawberries.

"Sheesh, did someone forget their purfume or something?" asked Cath, slightly gagging at the thought. However, she could figure out from the vial it was in that it wasn't purfume. It obviously looked like a kind of drink. Come to think of it, it had been a while since Cath was able to swipe herself a drink outside of water. However, she wasn't that stupid. The battlefield wasn't the kind of place to drink something that she was unfamiliar with.

"Oh well, might be worth checking out once I get out of here" she said to herself. Pocketing the vial, Cath began her escape, unlocking the nearby door and trying to get out. Thinking the view was clear, she stepped out, aiming for a quick escape.

"What'cha doing here, little lady?" asked a male voice from behind her. Cath lightly gasped and looked behind her, seeing an enemy of the Soldier class looking at her. Carrying a steel lance, his voice carried serious intent.

'Crud! I was so close too!' thought Cath. Cath knew she was in trouble if this soldier was skilled. His lance had an advantage over her tiny iron sword. However, there was no way she could get out of this without clashing blows at least once.

"Are you with that Pherean's army? If so, prepare to die!" said the soldier, preparing his lance, as he apparently wasn't expecting an answer. He had already answered it for himself.

'If I can dodge his initial strikes, I think my speed can get me out of here' thought Cath as she unsheathed her iron sword. She was a Thief after all, not a class fit for direct combat. Her iron sword was slightly modified, looking more like a knife or dagger.

The soldier struck first, lunging his lance forward. Despite being a steel lance, he was pretty quick with it. Unfortunately, a little quicker than Cath predicted. Bringing her sword up, she somewhat deflected the blow. However, her weapon was a poor choice for this fight, and she didn't have the muscle to outright block his strike.

The soldier grinned as he analyzed her actions. He knew exactly what he was dealing with: an experienced thief but hardly worhty for combat.

"Too slow!" said the soldier as he quickly struck again. Cath's redirect wasn't near enough to get him off balalnce from his first lunge, making a second strike all the easier and quicker. Using every ounce of her instincts, Cath tried to turn her body away to sidestep the dodge. However, it wasn't nearly enough, and the soldier's lance struck a great blow to the side of her right thigh.

"Ahhhh!" cried Cath as she fell to the ground hard. It wasn't a glancing blow, it was a direct strike that left a deep wound on her right high. Her skirt remained in tact, but her leg struggled to move with all the pain. Seething through the pain, Cath imagined that at least half her health was gone, if not more. Not to mention that the blood loss had almost numbed her leg, hindering any chance of escape for her.

'This isn't good! Gotta recover before he strikes again!' thought Cath as she reached for bag of items she carried on her waist. At first, she was about to grab a vulnerary, but then decided against it. A vulnerary was better for smaller wounds. It wouldn't do her any good. Luckily, she had brought an elixir with her. That would patch her up enough to get out.

Cath reached around in her bag for the elixir, smiling as she felt her hands grab a vial. The soldier wasn't waiting. She needed to hurry up and recover in time. Acting quickly, she grabbed the vial she had her hand on, quickly uncorked it with her mouth and drank it down heartily.

Wow. This elixir tastes...different' thought Cath. It had a very....strong taste to it, and actually tasted good, compared to past elixirs Cath had to ingest. If only she had noticed that the liquid wasn't the usual blue that elixirs were colored, but rather it was pink.

Unfortunately, this mental lapse gave the solider a free shot at Cath. Her mind was hardly focused on the solder now.

"Now you- AHHHH!" shouted the soldier as he felt a blade pass through his heart. Looking down, he saw the thin blade of a rapier before his eyes glazed over and his last breath left him. Cath heard the sound of the sword slice and started to turn around to face her savior.

"That was too close" said a soft masculine voice. Cath noticed that it was likely the guy who saved her.

'Hmph, I could have taken him. What's this guy's problem? though Cath, her usual stubbornness coming back to her. With her leg feeling a little better (but still needing some help), she turned to face her savior.

It was the young son of Pherae himself. Roy.
15533212221111.title: A Sudden Find

155332122211111.content:
Cath immediately turned her head to give this guy a piece of her mind. However, right when she did and her eyes met her savior, her body froze.

It was Roy, the son of Marquess Pherae and leader of the army. The very same Roy who had encountered her before at Castle Toria and Castle Ostia. She lividly remembered their discussions.they had: talking about whether or not Cath's actions were justified. Cath really didn't feel much for the Pherean noble. To her, he was as clueless as the rest of them. To that end, he seemed perplexed as she left the 2nd time at Castle Ostia, as if something she did hit a nerve.

However, while those past feelings came up, it wasn't quite what Cath immediately thought when she locked eyes with Roy. What came instead incredibly perplexed her.

His eyes were an amazing blue: a shade that seemed to embody the gentleness and compassion Roy was known for. Even among nobles, he was a handsome guy, and it made it all the better that he hardly cared for titles amongst his friends. His hair was a fiery red, just like his father, Eliwood, before him. Cath had seen these traits before, but now they couldn't leave her mind. She honestly couldn't move her body.

'What is wrong with me? Why is he looking at me like that?' thought Cath, somewhat arguing with herself to move. After briefly getting the blood off his rapier, Roy turned to Cath and his eyes widened in surprise.

"Cath? You made it here too?" asked Roy.

"Y-Yes" stuttered Cath, confusing her even more. She never stuttered before.

"I.....I want to apologize" said Roy, holding his head down a bit like a kid who been caught stealing.

"Huh?" asked Cath.

"Last time we met, I said some harsh things. I called you a villain without knowing about the things you had gone through" said Roy, his sincerity showing in his words. For some reason, Cath actually felt moved.

'Aw, that's actually kind of sweet' thought Cath before she could stop. Where in the world did she come up with that thought. "I-It's fine. I'm o-over it" she stuttered again, trying to get her odd thought off her mind.

"However, I still don't think you're doing the right thing!" said Roy, being a little more forceful than usual. Perhaps it was the certain tone, but Cath actually regained most of her senses with that.

"You've got a lot of nerve, saying that to me" she replied. Roy recoiled a bit at her reply, but easily readied his next sentence.

"Then, give me a chance. Watch me" he said.

"What?" asked Cath.

"When this war is over, I will make sure that the villages are restored to their former selves. I will see to it that the taxes villagers pay is put to proper use. So, until then, I would appreciate it if you would stop stealing" said Roy. His voice never rose to a hostile tone during that speech, always maintaining a peaceful tone that he was known for. Cath honestly felt her heart racing as her face went slightly red. Roy, obviously, didn't notice.

"And when would that be?" Cath asked.

"Whenever this war ends. I can't say exactly but it will happen" said Roy.

"Y-You sure?" asked Cath, that unsure tone coming back into her voice.

"Absolutely. In fact, why don't you come with us? You probably still don't really trust us, so I want you to see and watch us. I'll prove it to you" said Roy, smiling as he said it and offered his hand to shake on it. Cath felt that warm feeling in her chest come back, as her hand seemingly moved on its own. Her hand gently grabbed Roys, and she honestly couldn't come up with words to describe it. Roy, on the other hand, was glad.

"Ok, I'm glad to have you" said Roy. Cath once again couldn't come up with words.

'Why am I feeling like this? What happened?' thought the confused thief. Her mind was snapped out of it when a green-haired archer yelled and ran towards them.

"Lord Roy, we defeated the dragon!" yelled Wolt, happy to deliver the good news. Roy smiled back at him.

"Great! Well done. Too bad I was too busy to help" said Roy. Wolt shook his head.

"Don't worry. In all honesty, you wouldn't have been much help. The defense of those Manakettes is crazy. The only reason we won is thanks to Lilina and Lugh. Oh, and of course Lugh's brother" said Wolt. The last part confused Roy.

"His brother?" asked Roy.

"Yeah, his brother Lleu. We ran into them and Lugh convinced him to come" said Wolt, pointing over his shoulder. Roy and Cath looked over to see Lugh, a green-haired Mage, heckling another boy that looked just like him, with the exception of darker clothing. According to Wolt, Lleu was a Dark Mage.

"Come on Lleu! Chad's waiting for us! Let's play!" yelled Lugh, obviosuly happy to see his older twin sibling. Lleu's face was nothing short of frustrated at the moment.

"For the last time Lugh, I don't want to play. I grew out of those games long ago" contested Lleu. Lugh, in his childish enthusiasm, pretty much ignored it and dragged Lleu over to where Chad, a Thief and a friend of theirs, waited.

"Ah, brotherly love" laughed Wolt.

"Roy chuckled along with him, while Cath just looked at Roy, the unsettling feeling in her chest still lingering on.

'What in the world did I just get into?' was all she could think about.
155332122211111.title: New Feelings

1553321222111111.content:
Soon after the victory over the Manakette Aine, Eliphin informed Roy that they located a cabe that housed the legendary weapon of the Western Isles: the Thunder Axe, Armads. Naturally, Roy decided to pursue the axe, as getting each legendary weapon would be very important. After a little traveling, as the cave wasn't too far, Roy chose those who would enter the cave with him. After all, bandits had claimed the cave as their own, so they would need to be deal with first.

The selected fighters were: Lilina, Clarine, Wolt, Lugh, Lleu, Dieck, Rutger, and (to some surprise) Cath. Roy figured that she was the strongest thief of the bunch, a fact that made her blush instantly. Lugh and Lleu were brought due to how their magic could help against the slow and clumsy fighters of the bandits. Lugh delighted in fighting alongside his brother. However, the feeling wasn't mutual, at least judging my Lleu's exasperated expression. Clarine was the most effective healer and Rutger was a terror against axe-wielders. Liline offered good magic and support with Roy. Dieck had his own sword skills and Wolt was effective at long-range.

The cave was dark, as to be expected. Grero's bandit forces had spread all around, attempting to take the treasure in the cave for themselves.

"All right, there are 2 main pathways here. Lilina, Wolt, Cath and myself will go this way. You guys cover our rear on the other side. You'll face a lot of bandits most likely so Clarine will stay with you. Agreed?" commanded Roy. There was a collective "Yes sir!" throughout the group, except for Rutger who almost never talked. Cath was surprised to see herself cheer along, a fact that confused her to no end.

'Why am I acting this way?' she continuously wondered. Unfortunately, she never made the connection to the pink vial she found earlier, thinking that it was still a normal elixir. Not only that, she had left said vial back with Merlinus. Unknowingly to her, it had magically refilled itself.

Anyway, the group went their separate ways, fighting the bandits along the way. At the groups back end, Lugh and Lleu made quick work of whatever bandits they could attack, safely behind reasonable barriers with Dieck and Rutger. Rutger was nearly untouchable, even while enduring Clarine trying to talk to him.

"Wolt, you and Lilina scout over there. I see a couple of bandits. Shouldn't be too hard for you to take them out before they see you" said Roy. Wolt and Lilina nodded and followed their orders, although Lilina tossed a worried look back at Roy before leaving. Seeing this somehow made Cath feel a small pang in her chest, but she ignored it.

"Cath, how about you take care of these treasure chest over here? You should be fast enough to deal with those bandits" said Roy in his usual kind tone that never left his voice even when giving orders. Cath found herself giving a bit of a salute.

"Yes sir. They'll be no problem" said Cath, a smile on her face the whole time. She immediately went off to fulfill her part of the mission.

"Well, she's gotten really cooperative" muttered Roy to himself. Not that he objected in anyway, but it was nice to see Cath getting along so well. At least, that's how it was from his point of view.

Cath herself couldn't figure out why she was so willing to fulfill Roy's request. Not too long ago, she thought he was a stupid noble like the others. Now, she seemed to be happily following his command like anyone else.

"What is up with me? I mean, this feels nice somehow. But why?" she constantly wondered. Anyway, her train of thought was broken when an axe-wielding bandit appeared near the chest she was aiming for. Even in the darkness of the cave, Cath was easily capable of dealing with such a slow fighter. It barely took any time for her to slit the bandit's throat with her iron knife.

After pilfering the chest, she found her way back to Roy. The gang was nearing the spot where the bandit leader, Grero, was waiting. The bandit seemed initially stunned that so many had beaten his gang, but he didn't back down. The leader ran down and began clashing with Roy, who was too fast to take a bad hit from his steel axe. He was then stunned when a direct Thunder spell from Lilina struck him, which made things easier when a direct Elfire strike from Lugh made him stagger backwards, low on health.

Easy pickings for the others, Rutger came in, slashing him across the chest with his Killing Edge. As the leader fell, Cath, who had stayed away on Roy's orders, ran over to him.

"Are you alright?" she asked as she helped him to his feet. Roy wasn't hurt, but the force was fighting back with the strong bandit leader exhausted him.

"Don't worry, I'm ok. Thanks" said Roy, making Cath blush again. After investigating the throne in the back, the Thunder Axe Armads was discovered. The blade was a hulk of a weapon, befitting it's former wielder, Darbos.

Seeing such a weapon didn't deter Cath from her thoughts, which seemed to intensify as time went on.
1553321222111111.title: The Thunder Axe

1553321222211.title: Before Ike promotes

15533212222111.content:
Our story starts on the Griel Mercenaries' trip to Begnion. After consulting with King Caineghis of Gallia, the group traveled back to war-torn Crimea and boarded a ship. Their destination: the Begnion Empire, grandest of all nations on the continent of Tellius. The story happened ony way. This is another way, with many twists of fate transforming the lives of the warriors.

Anyway, the mercenaries and their friends were resting after a battle with some ravens from Kilvas. They made for tough foes so they really needed the rest. They were approximately 3/4 of the way to Begnion, with about a week or so left before they reached it's shores.

Meanwhile....

"Boss! Time to fight me!" yelled a feminine voice from the deck. Everyone knew that voice well. It was Mia, a mercenary hired by the Crimean Army who latered joined Ike's group. A myrmidon obsessed with finding her 'white-robed rival', the girl never took no for an answer. After traveling with the group for a while, she had 'fallen in love' with Ike's sword style, although how that was interpreted was never divulged. Anyway, it was barely sunrise, but everyone knew that's when Mia got up so they were used to it.

"Are you sure? Now?" asked a groggy Ike. He was a hard worker but even he wasn't much of a morning person.

"Of course! I've been dieing to try again after you beat me after our last match!" said Mia, completely excited with fire burning in her eyes.

"Wasn't really much of a match" muttered Ike. It really wasn't; Ike barely had to try to beat her. That's how far they were in skill. However, there was no escaping this so he sparred with her. Long story short; Ike won, convincingly.

"Oh, that's no good! I'll get you next time though!" said Mia, her smiled on her face and no lost confidence on her. Ike sighed but smiled at the energy of the female myrmidon. She would need such energy if they were to defeat Daein.

So, after the spar, Mia went off to the dining area to get a drink. She was thirsty after that fight. However, she ended up finding an odd vile on the table with an interesting color of fluid in it.
15533212222111.title: Ship Ride

155332122221111.content:
"Hmm, what's this?" asked Mia as she approached the blue vial. She brought it up and smelled it. It had a scent of bluebarries, which Mia actually liked.

"Well, I am thirsty so what's the harm?" she said as she got out a cup and started to pour herself some. She was always eager to try new things. However, she soon got a visitor.

"Oh Mia, how are you this morning?" asked a soft female voice. It was Princess Elincia of Crimea. She was Ike's charge in this war and Ike's job was to guard her. Elincia never really stoof on ceremony and got along well with the merenaries, which was in part thanks to her odd upbringing.

"Oh, I'm good. I came this close to beating Ike!" said Mia, bringing her right thumb and index finger together to get her point across. Elincia smiled, even though she pretty much guess that it was no where near that close a match.

"Anyway, what's that?" asked Elincia, pointing to the vial in Mia's hand.

"Oh this? Just something I found in here. You want some? Let's share" said Mia. Elincia didn't see the danger in such a thing.

"Ok sure" said Elincia as she grabbed herself a cup and Mia poured the whole vial into the two cups. There wasn't much in the small vial. Without a second thought, the two girls drank down the odd drink.

"Hmm, not bad. That felt goo..." started Mia before she started to feel faint. In an instant, both of the girls fainted on the ground, unaware of what they had just done to themselves.

Who to follow now?
155332122221111.title: Blue Potion

1553321222211111.content:
Elincia felt like she had the biggest headache she ever had as her eyes slowly opened up.

"Ough, what hit me?" she groggily asked. However, she got responded to in a way she didn't expect.

"You alright Mia?" asked a male voice. 'Huh? Mia? Is he talking to be?' thought Elincia. She could tell the voice was from Ike and she turned her heads towards him and confirmed her suspisions. However, she was confused as to why he said Mia.

"You doing ok Mia? Guess you exhausted yourself too much or something" said Ike with a small smile. Elincia was confused. Ike definately was talking to her but he kept calling her Mia.

"Why are you.." she started before she gasped. That was not her voice! She looked down and realized that she was not wearing her usual princess dress that she had been wearing this whole time. She was wearing a small orange garment that was sleeveless and the 'skirt' as you could call it was small, hardly similar to the large ballroom skirt Elincia's dress had. Her legs were covered by black stockings with typical black footwear. Her forearms were also covered similarly. She turned her head and grabbed a piece of her hair. It was purple (sort of).

"What happened to me?" she asked herself, thinking that she must be dreaming.

15533222222222122.content:
It had been a couple months since the whole Rescue Rukia thing in the Soul Society.

Ichigo Kurosaki, the substitute Soul Reaper, was getting back to his usual life. Well, as usual as he will ever get it.

Anyway, when during the day do we start?
15533222222222122.title: after that

155332222222221221.content:
After enduring his usual wake up call from his dad and had breakfast made by his sister, Ichigo was walking off towards school.

"Sheesh, dad is such a pain in the ass." He mumbled to himself, referencing his dad's aggressive means of waking him up. Ichigo walked all the way to school by himself, as Rukia had already left a while before.

Eventually, he reached the school. However, as he neared the school, he spotted something in the bushes nearby.

"What is that?" He wondered out loud. He decided to investigate before heading in. He walked over to the bushes.

What does he find?
155332222222221221.title: at school

1553322222222212211.content:
Inside the bushes, Ichigo discovered a vial full of blue liquid. "What is that?" He asked himself. However, school is about to begin. "Oh, what the heck." He said as he picked it up and took it in with him in his backpack.

Ichigo enters his classroom and sets down his stuff. "What took you so long?" A familiar voice asked. Ichigo turned around to see Rukia looking at him.

"What do you mean?" He asked.

"Well, you're usually earlier." She replied.

"It's nothing." Ichigo said in response. Rukia just decided to leave it alone. After a couple of hours, lunch break began. As Ichigo picked up his stuff, he didn't notice that the blue potion had fallen out of his bag. However, after he left, Orihime sees it on the ground.

"What is this?" She wonder out loud in confusion. "Oh well, I forgot to bring a drink anyway!" She said happily, not even a hint of worry of seeing such a foreign object. She put it in her bag and walked out.
1553322222222212211.title: blue potion

15533222222222122111.content:
Ichigo went up to his usual eating place on the top of the school building. However, as he got up there, Rukia and Orihime appeared.

"Hey you too, what are you doing up here?" Ichigo asked.

"Oh, we thought we'd eat up here with you this time. Honestly, that group is starting to annoy me." Rukia said, saying the last part about Orihime's friends a little more quietly. Ichigo just shrugged his shoulders and allowed them to stick around. Apparently, Uryu and Chad weren't going to join today.

As Ichigo ate his lunch, he heard Orihime talk. "So Rukia, do you want to share my drink?" Orihime asked, holding up a cup of the blue liquid.

"Sure, why not?" Rukia replied as she took a cup. Ichigo saw the blue liquid inside.
15533222222222122111.title: lunch time

155332222222221221111.content:
Ichigo sees the blue liquid that the two girls are about to drink. 'Hmm, odd color' he thinks, not noticing that it was the potion he pocketed earlier.

"Down you go!" says Orihime as she golps down her drink. Rukia drinks hers a little more slowly. The drink tasted sort of like blueberries but kind of different.

"Wow, what was good!" says Orihime in delight. "Yes, it was good" agreed Rukia. The potion would take a little bit to work it's magic however.

A few minutes later, Ichigo finished up his lunch. "Well, I have to do something before the next class. See you then" he said as he picked his stuff up and began to walk away. Both of the girls said farewell to him as well.

What's next?
155332222222221221111.title: He doesn't notice anything strange

1553322222222212211111.content:
"Shall we head back?" Rukia asked as she finished her lunch.

"Sure." Orihime replied. However, just as the two girls got up, they started to feel a little woozy. "I...feel...dizzy..." Orihime said as she blacked out. The same happened to Rukia. The last they felt was the feeling of being outside their bodies. A few minutes later, Orihime woke up, feeling very groggily. "Ugh, I feel strange." She said. Then, her eyes widened in surprise. 'That's not my voice!' She thought. She looked down to see that she was still wearing the school uniform, but she noticed that her bust was significantly smaller than usual. Not only that, she couldn't feel her usually long hair on her back. She grabbed her hair and noticed that not only was it short, it was black.

"W-What happened?" She stammered. Then, she turned around and saw what looked like her body slowly getting up.

As her body got up, it said "You ok, Orihime?" Orihime was shocked to see her own body talking to her.

"Who are you?" She asked, kind of terrified.

"What are you talking about? It's me, Rukia." Her body said as it turned to her. The two just looked at each other in shock. Eventually, the wheels in their heads started to turn until it finally clicked.

"What are you doing in my body?!" Both girls yelled at once.
1553322222222212211111.title: potion takes effect

15533222222222122111112.content:
Orihime and Rukia were shocked to be in each other's bodies, not making the connection to the blue potion. It really took some getting used to, and frankly, by the time school was over, they still weren't used to it. They had no idea how it had happened. Orihime kept freaking out about being in someone else's body, while Rukia tried to calm her down. At lunch, they didn't have time to figure out why this happened so they had to go to class as is. They pretty much avoided eye contact with anyone, and didn't speak with anyone, not even Ichigo, as to not worry him, although it made him worry more with how they were acting (not that they knew that).

Eventually, class ended for the day.
15533222222222122111112.title: after school

155332222222221221111122.content:
After school was finished for he day, Ichigo walked home alone. "I wonder what was up with Rukia and Orihime. They sure were acting weird after lunch. Maybe I'll talk to them about it tomorrow." He said to himself as he walked home. Little did he know that another potion would enter his life soon enough. He entered his home. Isshin, his dad, started with his usual welcome home present for Ichigo: A kick to the head. "What the hell old man?!" Ichigo yelled at his dad.

"You let your guard down again!" Isshin replied.

"That's it!" Ichigo yelled as the father and son started to fight again.

"Stop it you two!" Yuzu said as she was preparing dinner.

"Just let them fight." Karin said. Yuzu reluctantly turned away and proceeded with making dinner. As she does, she starts to get a little thirsty.

"I wonder what we have to drink." She says to herself as she looks around. However, her eyes land on a certain something that appeared on the counter.
155332222222221221111122.title: follow Ichigo

1553322222222212211111221.content:
A vial of orange potion was sitting there on the counter. Yuzu had no idea how it got there but she mistaked it for some orange juice.

"This looks tasty" said Yuzu as she picked up the vial and poured all of it into a cup. She drunk it down in only a few gulps, savoring the rather addicting taste of it. Like the color, it tasted like oranges.

"Hmm, that was good"said Yuzu as she finished up. As she went back to preparing dinner, she felt kind of strange inside as if something in her was waiting to be unleashed (in reality it was waiting for her to look at a male).

As Yuzu turned around, who entered the kitchen?
1553322222222212211111221.title: an orange potion

15533222222222122111112211.content:
"Hey Yuzu, you almost done?" Ichigo asked as he entered the kitchen.

"Oh yes Ichigo, in a min.." Yuzu began. However, she was unterrupted as soon as her eys landed on Ichigo. As her eys landed on him, a strange feeling grew in her stomach. 'What am I feeling right now?' She thought in her head.

Does the change happen now or later?
15533222222222122111112211.title: Ichigo

155332222222221221111122112.content:
Fortunately for Yuzu, it won't happen at this moment, but it will happen soon. The strange feeling starts to calm down within her.

"Yuzu, are you ok?" asked Ichigo with concern. "Oh, I'm fine. Dinner's almost done" said Yuzu, trying not to worry him.

About 10-15 minutes later, the whole family settles down for dinner. Well, almost. Ichigo and Isshin are still fighting.

"Knock it off you two" says Yuzu trying to calm them down. "Let it go Yuzu, they'll keep fighting until their 60's if they want to" said Karin rather bluntly. "That's not very nice Karin" replied Yuzu. Karin just shrugged.

After dinner was complete, Yuzu had completely forgotton about earlier but it would be back soon enough.
155332222222221221111122112.title: later

1553322222222212211111221121.content:
Eventually, the family of 4 had retired to their beds. Most of them were enjoying a peaceful sleep. However, Yuzu was tossing and turning around in her bed. She was tensing, as if she was having a bad dream. The potion was beginning to take effect on her body now.

"Yuzu, are you alright?" asked Karin, shaking Yuzu awake. Yuzu woke up and looked at Karin, breathing hard.

"K-Karin? Y-Yeah, I'm fine" said Yuzu, managing a weak smile. Karin didn't really seem to believe her.

"Well, if you're sure" said Karin. She went back to her bed on the other side of the room. Yuzu didn't know what was happening but she figured that it would pass over by the time the morning came around. With that in mind, she tired to sleep a little better this time. Things wouldn't be the same after this night.

She didn't feel a thing as her limbs began to grow.

*****Morning*****

Karin yawned and stretched out her limbs, waking up to a new day.

"Well, that sleep turned out well. I wonder if Yuzu got better" said Karin as she looked over to Yuzu's bed. Maybe she was seeing things, but the lump under the blanket seemed bigger than normal. Yuzu was completely under the blanket but Karin could swear that she was never that big.

"What's going on?" asked Karin as she walked over and lightly grabbed the blanket and lifted it to get a better view. She was stunned silent right there and then.

She didn't see a little 10-year old on that bed. Instead, it was the form of a beautiful 16-year old girl with shoulder-length hair the same color of Yuzu.
1553322222222212211111221121.title: that night

155332222222222111.title: What time?

1553322222222221111.content:
Academy City, Japan. A supercity of two point three million people, over eighty percent of which are students. And those students study, not conventional school topics, but psychic powers. The technology used in this city is twenty-to-thirty years ahead of the outside world, so the whole city is essentially one big experiment.

Touma Kamijyo, the weakest Level Zero psychic – the lowest of the low – was sitting on a park bench, lamenting his typically abysmal luck (just today, he had dropped a ten-thousand-yen bill and had it blown away by the wind, and while chasing it, he had enraged Mikoto Misaka, aka Shocker because she was a temperamental Level Five Electromaster, by accidentally peeking up her skirt, and had to fight her off while attempting to explain the situation, and in so doing, lost the bill forever), when he saw something in the bushes behind him. “What is this…?” he said aloud, twisting around to reach it. This proved inefficient, so because he had nothing better to do at the moment, he leaned forward to try and reach it. Thankfully, the bench was nailed down, so Touma was able to reach a lot farther than he normally would because the bench wouldn’t tip over on him.

A few more inches… and… got it! Touma grabbed the thing (which was a preservation jar filled with some kind of liquid), and no sooner did he grab it, than he heard a very unwelcome voice behind him saying, “Hey.”

Crap! It was Mikoto Misaka. Touma lost his grip on the bench and fell into the bushes.

“What are you doing, Touma?” Mikoto asked. She was looking at Touma in a way that reminded him of their first meeting. She was holding a can of soda in her right hand, and a can of curry in her left.

Touma scrambled to his feet, ready to fight, and was surprised when she threw the soda at him, which he caught. Not only was this a shockingly ineffective attack coming from her (or anyone), but Touma didn’t see her as the kind of person to waste maybe three hundred yen on a soda can from a vending machine when she could get it for free with either a high kick or a blast of electricity. And since the security droids (which looked like private-use garbage cans that could move) weren’t there, she must have bought it legally.

All Touma could say was, “Huh?”

“Look, I’m sorry, okay?” Mikoto said, flushing slightly and turning her head to the left. “And… I lost you that ten thousand yen, so consider this repayment. So would you stop hiding in the bushes?”

Touma worked his way back to the bench and sat in it, still holding the jar and the soda. “Thanks, and I accept, but you really don’t have to do this.” He popped the tab on the soda, and it sprayed him in the face. “Such misfortune,” he muttered.

Mikoto popped the tab on her curry, drank out of it slightly, and immediately spit it out. “What the hell? I thought I got a lemon soda!”

“That’s what you get for not paying attention,” Touma said unsympathetically. He drank deeply of his soda, which wasn’t really to his tastes.

“Hey, aren’t you supposed to sympathize with me here or something?” Mikoto asked. “At least give me that other thing you’re holding!”

“What, this?” Touma asked, holding up the jar. “I found this in the bushes.”

“Whatever, just give it here!” Mikoto said impatiently, taking it away from him before he could react. She unscrewed the top and drank the entire thing’s contents.

What color was the potion?
1553322222222221111.title: A Certain Repentant Railgun

15533222222222211112.content:
Mikoto gasped for breath. "Tastes like crap," she said simply.

"Then why'd you drink it?" Touma asked.

Mikoto looked at Touma like he was crazy. "I drank it to cool down!" she said, but then she flushed as the potion took effect.

"In that case, just drink the curry if taste doesn't matter," Touma said, but he got cut off as Mikoto started to cuddle up to him. "Hey... wha..." As Mikoto started to gently push him to the bench, in prime position for a kiss, Touma started to get extremely nervous.

"Touma..." Mikoto said. "I love you." Pushing Touma down onto the bench full-way, Mikoto crawled up his chest, positioning herself so that she could kiss him on the lips. Touma struggled half-heartedly against Mikoto's embrace, knowing that this was wrong, but enjoying it despite himself.

"N-no," Touma said, and then shouted to the sky, "Such misfortune!!!"

Mikoto seemed to snap out of whatever trance she had been. "Oh, am in the way? I'm sorry," she said, getting off Touma and taking her place at the other end of the bench with tears budding in her eyes.

"Great, idiot," Touma said to himself. "Now you've made a girl cry." To Mikoto he said, "Look, don't worry about it, okay? You're... not in the way, okay? But I'd rather we save it for private."

"Yeah, I guess," Mikoto said.

"So tell me, what made you suddenly want to kiss me?"

“I love you,” Mikoto said, unusually shyly. Most of her actions toward Touma were so aggressive they were borderline assault. “I have loved you for as long as I’ve known you, and it’s only gotten stronger. I can’t live without you, I can’t live without your love! So please, say you love me! Say you love me!”

Touma looked around. A crowd had gathered, only natural considering that not a minute previously, they had appeared to be starting sex. In public. In broad daylight. “Just my luck,” he said to himself. “Okay, I love you,” he said, mainly to shut her up while avoiding a scene. “Now could we leave here? Like maybe to my…” Touma remembered that he had Index at his dormitory room. “No, on second thought, how about your dormitory?” Then he remembered all sorts of things, including Mikoto’s lesbian roommate Kuroko Shirai (a Teleporter), and the fact that Mikoto’s dormitory was all-girl and strictly regulated. “Wait a second, that won’t work either, will it? Such misfortune.”
15533222222222211112.title: Pink

155332222222222111122.content:
"Okay," Touma said. "I think it's best if we just go to our respective dorm rooms for the night."

"What? Why?" Mikoto asked.

"Well, at your dorm, there's that Teleporter," Touma pointed out. "And then my dorm..." has Index, Touma would have said, except that he didn't want Mikoto meeting Index for reasons that he found unfathomable. "Look, trust me, it's a bad idea for you to stay at my dorm room."

"Okay," Mikoto said, accepting Touma's decision a bit too readily considering her aggressive, if newly blossomed, feelings. "Promise you'll meet me tomorrow?"

"That might be problematic," Touma said, grimacing. "But okay, I''ll try. Where and when?"

Mikoto started thinking. "Hmm... how about here, and at four PM?" She didn't want to set it too early, because that might be a bit too "problematic", but she also wanted to see Touma again as soon as possible.

"Sounds good," Touma said. "Okay, see you tomorrow."

"Alright," Mikoto said.


At his dorm, Touma provided Index with a hearty meal with plenty of servings, as usual, and then asked, "Hey, Index."

“What is it, Touma?” Index asked.

“Is there anything that my Imagine Breaker can’t negate?”

Index’s demeanor changed from casual to serious. “What happened?”

“Well…” Touma scratched his head and related the day’s events. “Do you have any explanation?”

Index was silent for a moment. “The Potions of Belphegor,” she said. “According to legend, they were brought from hell to this world by a demon. They are meant to cause chaos, and their effects cannot be negated by any means currently available to any organization. Every once in awhile, one of the potions finds its way into humans’ hands.”

Touma was silent for a while. “Just to confirm. These potions can’t be negated?”

“No.”

“Such misfortune,” Touma said mournfully.
155332222222222111122.title: Touma and Mikoto part ways.

1553322222222222211121.content:
Pirachu is just an average lowlife who sells pirated games all over Gamindustri. After the defeats of ASIC and the Seven Sages, order is once again restored to the landmasses making life difficult for those who does his line of work.

Having already given up on his daily underground sales, Pirachu stops to Lastation for the night in the hopes of making a greater income in some other nation the next day.

On his way towards the dark alley that he uses as his hideout, he encounters a strange hooded figure standing in front of him.

"Say, I would exchange something valuable in return for all those tools and game copies that you have right now?", the man said.

"Really? What could you possibly offer me that's worth all this stuff?", the little gray mouse asked.

The man had a sudden grin on his face and said, " Oh, but the thing I'm about to give you is something worth more than what you have right now, and you won't regret it."

Having said this, he took a vial on his bag that contains...
1553322222222222211121.title: A small-time criminal

choices: The CPU of Lastation, Noire/Black Heart.
The CPU candidate of Lastation, Uni/Black Sister.
15533222222222222111212.content:
"Really? And what can this small vial do for me anyway? Will it make me rich in an instant or be the head of an underground syndicate making lots of moves in Gamindustri?", Pirachu asked as he bombarded the man with his questions.

With this the man calmly said, " Very well, I will answer your question. This potion will do none of those things, and I never intended for you to drink it. But I will tell you this, it will grant you an opportunity that you have never dreamed of, believe it or not."

"Sound suspicious, but I will take it. If it doesn't work, I will track you down from wherever you hide. I still have connections that I can use to find you.", Pirachu said with a small smile on his face.

"You're welcome to try, but once you do, you will beg me to give more of it to you, hehe," the man laughs as he disappears in the night.

"Well, I guess I'll do something about this tomorrow", Pirachu says as he retreats back to his old hovel.

The next day, Pirachu continues to ponder on what to do with the small vial of bronze liquid the man gave him. He then stumbles upon a Guild quest board filled with all sorts of requests. With no money left, he decides to look for a simple but decent job for a change.

"I guess doing this once in a while will help me get back at my feet", he ponders.

As he was browsing among the jobs, he found an interesting one that says;

"I am looking for someone who can brew me a medicine that can help me improve my voice acting. If you're interested, come to Lastation square at 7pm tonight. Either I will pick it up personally or send someone to pick it up and give you the reward.

Having recalled the bronze potion that he has, Pirachu picks up the request in the hopes of making a quick buck tonight.

"If this potion can help out, I'll be staying at an inn tonight and have a decent dinner for a change.", he thought.

After the day passed, Pirachu arrives at Lastation square and found it deserted. As he patiently waits for the client, a person arrives at the square's rest area. Wondering if this is the client for the request, Pirachu comes closer, and was surprised when he saw.....
15533222222222222111212.title: A Bronze potion.

choices: Have fun with her some more.
155332222222222221112121.content:
Noire noticed Pirachu approaching her, as she remembers something.

"Wait a minute, you're that mouse who was with ASIC and the Seven Sages, right? Have you come here to trick me into drinking that potion of yours, huh? Well, it's not going to work, or better yet, I'll finish you off right here!" Noire draws out her rapier, and Pirachu desperately tries to plead for his life as he knelt and said,

"No! You've got it all wrong! I am a changed mouse looking to straighten up my life after all that's happened before! I never intended to poison you or anything, I'm doing this just to make some money for a living, that's all!"

"Well, I remember you as a low class villain before who got dragged into that unfortunate mess with Arfoire. All right, I believe you. Just give me the potion and forget the fact that I am secretly voice acting, that's the deal."

"All right," said the gray-haired mouse as Noire hands him the money for the request. As he walks away, Pirachu saw Noire who's about to drink the potion immediately after she got it. Curious of what its effects were, he stayed. After the CPU finished drinking all of it, he noticed something strange about her. Noire's mind got blank, and she was just staring right at him plainly. Worried, he then approached her, saying, "Hey, are you all right?", but got no reply.

"No way," said the mouse as he ponders on what to do with the now doll-like expression of Noire. Not wanting to leave her in such a deserted place, Pirachu thinks of a way for her to come with him for the time being. All the while, he said, "It's not like I want to make her follow me wherever I go, so what should I do,". He was then surprised to see her following him on the way out of the square after what he said.

"Could this be the effect of that potion that man gave me?", Pirachu asked himself. Then he decided to test it to make sure. From out of the blue, he thought of himself wanting to embrace Compa before. He then said, "Noire, hug me!." He felt more surprised that the proud CPU of Lastation quickly hugged him the way he instructed her to.

"Well, I could get used to this, hehe" Pirachu muttered as he thinks of what to do with her.
155332222222222221112121.title: The CPU of Lastation, Noire/Black Heart.

choices: to do it in her human form.
make her transform into her HDD form.

1553322222222222211121212.title: Pirachu's fun begins

15533222222222222111212122.content:
Pirachu came up with another idea in order to have his "fun" with Noire. In the past, he recalled clashing with the CPUs in their HDD states, and he can't help but fantasize the things he could do with them wearing just skin tight suits.

"Hmm, I guess this is my chance to screw one of them in those sexy forms, hehe," he chuckled. Then he ordered Noire to enter her goddess form.

"Noire, I command you to transform!", said Pirachu with a smile on his lips. The twin-tailed CPU, who is under Pirachu's complete control did so without hesitation.

"Access....", said the Lastation CPU without a hint of thought on her face, as a sudden light envelops her.

After a few seconds, a familiar form stands before the gray-haired mouse. A girl with a delicate figure, with her white hair, teal-colored eyes, wearing nothing but a one-piece bodysuit exposing her thighs and a pair of long, black boots. Noire had entered her HDD form, but her mind is still under the effects of Pirachu's potion.

"Damn, as I thought, their HDD forms are hot!" said the excited mouse as he had a sudden erection just by looking at Black Heart's body.

"Now, let's begin our steamy evening, my slave," as he plans on what to do first.
15533222222222222111212122.title: Black Heart's Goddess Form
